thread.title: Brooklyn gang members busted for string of bank robberies
thread.title_full: Brooklyn gang members busted for string of bank robberies

author: CHRISTINA CARREGA
title: Brooklyn gang members busted for string of bank robberies
text:
Brooklyn gang members busted for string of bank robberies Brooklyn gang members busted for string of bank robberies Nine alleged gang members and their associates have been caught after they allegedly stole over $94,000 from banks by depositing counterfeit checks (Barry Williams/for New York Daily News) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS  21 PM 
A group of Brooklyn gang members was busted for stealing from various banks, prosecutors said Wednesday. 
Five members of Folk Nation, Flatbush G-Stone Crips and a subset of the 8-Tray Crips gang called Bosses in Business allegedly deposited 241 counterfeit checks — then withdrew over $94,000 from 71 unsuspected financial institutions. 
"We now know that gang members are increasingly using financial fraud to pay for their lifestyle,” said Acting Brooklyn District Attorney Eric Gonzalez. 
Those arrested were: Trumane Gibbs, 23; Michael Morris, 21; Darnell Brown, 24; Tevon Allen, 28; Daquan Johnson, 24; Timothy Brown, 23; Jeffrey Debrosse, 27; Julian Hubbard, 21, and Jermel Belfast, 30. 
Morris, Belfast, Allen, Darbell, Brown and Debrosse were arraigned Tuesday in Brooklyn Supreme Court. 
The others are still at large, authorities said. Acting Brooklyn District Attorney Eric Gonzalez said, "gang members are increasingly using financial fraud to pay for their lifestyle." (Barry Williams/for New York Daily News) 
Between June 2014 and March 2016, they recruited people to open new accounts or provided information from existing accounts at Bank of America, TD Bank, Capital One and JP Morgan Chase. 
The gang members then deposited the bogus checks and quickly withdrew the funds, prosecutors said. 
“We will continue to investigate and prosecute this facet of gang activity to get dangerous individuals off the streets and make sure stolen money isn’t used to fund violent acts,” said Gonzalez. 
If convicted, the men face up to seven years in prison. Tags:
